title: Q2 - What happens when Indian law conflicts with foreign privacy laws (like GDPR or CCPA)?
description: When Indian law — specifically the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 (DPDPA) — conflicts with foreign privacy frameworks such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) of the EU or the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) of the U.S., the applicable law depends on where the data is being processed and which users the data belongs to.

previous.title: Q1 - If an Indian user’s data is processed abroad (e.g., on AWS servers in the U.S.), is the foreign company also bound by DPDPA?

next.title: Q3 - Can an Indian company freely transfer anonymized data abroad?
